title: Sultanate of Sulu
summary: The Sultanate of Sulu (Arabic: سلطنة سولك‎, Tausūg: كاسولتانن سين سوڬ, Malay: کسلطانن سولو دار الإسلام) was a Muslim state[note 1] that ruled the islands in the Sulu Archipelago, parts of Mindanao in today's Philippines, certain portions of Palawan and north-eastern Borneo (present-day the certain parts of Sabah and North Kalimantan).
